OVERVIEW



 
ENERGY EFFICIENCY PROGRAMS FOR UTILITIES
  July 24 – 25, 2007
                    

Rate cases. Petitions to build new generation plants. Increasing regulatory mandates. Any of these on their own is reason enough to invigorate your energy efficiency program offerings to customers. 
 
Utilities are pressed to offer customers energy efficiency programs. Though regulatory pressure is good enough reason to do this, there are ways these programs can be successful businesses on their own. 
 
What does a well-designed energy efficiency program look like? How can these programs be marketed effectively to customers? How can your utility actually increase revenues from such an undertaking? 
 
If you are interested in learning the answers to these questions, you must attend this timely conference!
 

DEMAND RESPONSE AND LOAD MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR UTILITIES
  July 26 – 27, 2007

Demand Response systems are in place at hundreds of utilities across the country and millions of devices have been installed. 
 
Some of these programs have been operating since the early 1980s and have nearly 30 years of data to show for it. 
 
Demand Response is far from being a new technology, however new pricing structures and new business models are enabling it to be utilized in ways it has never been utilized before.                        
  
Hear the experts on Demand Response share the experiences and best practices. 
 
Survey new technologies that are needed to achieve demand response  gains. Obtain an understanding of the impact  wholesale electricity markets  have on demand response programs.
